Legal_Issue: Procedural fairness, blending of residency tests, reasonableness of decision
Application_Facts: Applicant failed to provide documentation for a 106-day period; credibility issues identified
Remedy_Requested: Allowance of appeal and grant of citizenship
Court_Ruling: Decision was procedurally fair, no improper blending of tests, ruling was reasonable
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged denial of procedural fairness, improper test application, unreasonable residency assessment
Legal_Standard: Physical presence of 1,095 days required; procedural fairness reviewed on correctness; residency determination reviewed on reasonableness
Assessment_Factor: Credibility of applicant, sufficiency of documentation, application of Pourghasemi test
Procedural_Issue: Allegation of procedural unfairness in the judge's evaluation
Review_Standard: Correctness for procedural fairness; reasonableness for residency determination
Credibility_Assessment: Applicant found to have credibility issues affecting evidence reliability
Evidence_Used: Residency records, application documents, supporting materials
Application_Basis: Requirement to prove 1,095 days of physical presence in Canada
Evidence_Assessed: Documentation gaps over 106 days; lack of corroborating evidence
Governing_Rule: Applicant must meet strict physical presence requirement under s 5(1)(c)
Cause_Description: Applicant's citizenship application was denied due to insufficient proof of residency
Evidence_Handling: Judge assessed available evidence and found it inadequate to meet burden of proof
Evidence_Issues: Incomplete documentation, unverified periods of residence
Evidence_Assessment: Strict application of Pourghasemi test; emphasis on documented physical presence
Decision_Rationale: Decision was reasonable, based on credible assessment of incomplete evidence
Decision_Making_Body: Citizenship Judge, Federal Court on appeal
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to meet evidentiary burden for continuous residency
Legal_Standard_Applied: Reasonableness standard for factual findings; correctness for procedural fairness
